title: Diploma in Human Nutrition
headline: Improving your overall health and wellness is easy with this free online health and nutrition course.
description: This free online course in Human Nutrition is a comprehensive introduction to the role of nutrition in our growth and development throughout our lives. With the huge rise in diet-related illnesses such as obesity, type II diabetes, and cardiovascular disease, we face important choices in terms of food and nutrition on a daily basis. This course will help you make better choices that will ensure good health and wellness.

courseDescription:
There are three energy-yielding macronutrients that our bodies need to consume on a daily basis to maintain important functions such as growth and energy production. These are carbohydrates, proteins, and lipids. This human nutrition course online discusses these nutrients that provide the essential components for our bodies.

The human digestive system plays a complex and wonderful bodily function which will be covered in this human nutrition online course. You will also learn the various groups of carbohydrates, lipids, and proteins including their metabolic pathways and functions. The lessons will also cover the three main types of amino acids, the roles and the eicosanoid compounds derived from fatty acids, the various vitamins and minerals, and the structure and functions of antioxidants.

This Diploma course is rich with insights on human nutrition and the roles macronutrients and micronutrients play in maintaining good health. It will benefit health-conscious individuals and healthcare professionals who would like to learn more about how to live a healthier life. They say that you are what you eat, so take charge of your wellbeing today with this nutrition and human health online course.

Start Course Now
certificateDetail:
All Alison courses are free to enrol study and complete. To successfully complete this diploma course and become an Alison Graduate, you need to achieve 80% or higher in each course assessment. Once you have completed this diploma course, you have the option to acquire an official Diploma, which is a great way to share your achievement with the world.

Your Alison diploma is:
  • Ideal for sharing with potential employers
  • Include it in your CV, professional social media profiles and job applications.
  • An indication of your commitment to continuously learn, upskill & achieve high results.
  • An incentive for you to continue empowering yourself through lifelong learning.
Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:
  • Digital diploma: a downloadable diploma in PDF format immediately available to you when you complete your purchase.
  • diploma: a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked diploma, posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed diploma: a physical version of your officially branded and security marked diploma in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.
Start Course Now

All diploma are available to purchase through the Alison Shop. For more information on purchasing Alison diploma, please visit our FAQs. If you decide not to purchase your Alison diploma, you can still demonstrate your achievement by sharing your Learner Record or Learner Achievement Verification, both of which are accessible from your Dashboard. For more details on our diploma pricing, please visit our Pricing Page

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, you will learn about different terms associated with nutrition. You will be introduced to different types of nutrients and how food energy is measured. You will also discover various non-nutritive compounds that provide health benefits.
topics: Introduction to Human Nutrition - Learning Outcomes
Introduction to Human Nutrition - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: This module will teach you about the various methods of nutrition research and about how research results are analysed, published and interpreted.
topics: Nutrition and Science Research - Learning Outcomes
Nutrition and Science Research - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.details: Diploma in Human Nutrition - First Assessment
modules.description: You must score 80% or more to pass this assessment.
topics: Diploma in Human Nutrition - First Assessment

modules.name: Module
modules.details: Introduction to the Human Digestive System
modules.description: In this module, you will learn about the human digestive system and the processes involved in digestion.The three main food types will be explained to you: Carbohydrates, Lipids and Protein. You will also learn about vitamins.
topics: Introduction to the Human Digestive System - Learning Outcomes
Introduction to the Human Digestive System
Introduction to the Human Digestive System - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, you will learn about how food is processed in the body through Digestion, Absorption, Elimination and Protection You will learn how waste materials are eliminated from the human body. You will also learn about the protection mechanisms of the digestive system.
topics: Digestion, Absorption, Elimination and Protection - Learning Outcomes
Digestion, Absorption, Elimination and Protection - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.details: Diploma in Human Nutrition - Second Assessment
modules.description: You must score 80% or more to pass this assessment.
topics: Module 6: Diploma in Human Nutrition - Second Assessment

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, you will learn about carbohydrates. You will be shown the formulas associated with carbohydrates and you will discover the different types of carbohydrates. Finally, you will be taught about alternative sweeteners and complex carbohydrates.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, you will learn about proteins, amino acids and their structures. You will learn about the process of protein synthesis.and about levels of protein structure and various protein functions.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: This module will teach you all about lipids. You will be introduced to different fatty acids and the naming systems for fatty acids. You will learn about the food sources of fatty acids and about essential fatty acids and eicosanoids.
topics: Fatty Acid Naming and Food Sources

modules.name: Module
modules.details: Diploma in Human Nutrition - Third Assessment
modules.description: You must score 80% or more to pass this assessment.
topics: Diploma in Human Nutrition - Third Assessment

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module you will learn about metabolism, in specific the anabolic and catabolic processes and how they relate to metabolism. You will learn about oxidation and reduction and the two common co-factors and their functions.
topics: Introduction to Macronutrient Metabolism - Learning Outcomes
Introduction to Macronutrient Metabolism - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, you will learn about monosaccharide metabolism and the processes glycogenesis and glycogenolysis. You will learn about glycolysis and the transition reaction. This module will also discuss the citric acid cycle and the electron transport chain. Anaerobic respiration is also covered.
topics: Aerobic Glucose Metabolism Totals and Anaerobic Respiration

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, you will learn about lipolysis. You will learn about the process of fatty acid oxidation. This module also focuses on fatty acid synthesis, ketone synthesis and cholesterol synthesis.
topics: Fatty Acid Synthesis, Ketone Body Synthesis and Cholesterol Synthesis

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, you will learn about different protein metabolism pathways. Transamination, deamination, gluconeogenesis and protein degradation are key processes that will be discussed.

modules.name: Module
modules.details: Diploma in Human Nutrition - Fourth Assessment
modules.description: You must score 80% or more to pass this assessment.
topics: Diploma in Human Nutrition - Fourth Assessment

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, you will learn about vitamins and minerals. You will learn about different categories of minerals such as fat-soluble and water-soluble vitamins.You will also learn about the two schools of thought on how to cover vitamins and minerals in nutrition classes.
topics: Introduction to Vitamins and Minerals - Learning Outcomes
Introduction to Vitamins and Minerals - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, you will learn about antioxidant minerals and vitamins. You will learn about free radicals, reactive oxygen species (ROS) and oxidative stress. You will learn about the components of antioxidant enzymes and the antioxidant network. You will also learn whether too much antioxidants can cause harm.
topics: Too Much Antioxidants A Good Thing?

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, you will learn about different forms of vitamin E. You will learn about vitamin E absorption, metabolism and excretion.Discover the food sources of vitamin E and vitamin E deficiency and toxicity. You will also learn about the dietary reference intake decisions and international units.
topics: Vitamin E Absorption, Metabolism and Excretion
Dietary Vitamin E, Vitamin E Deficiency and Toxicity

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, you will learn about vitamin C absorption, transport, recycling and tissue accumulation. You will learn about the enzymatic functions of vitamin C and about vitamin C deficiency and toxicity. Linus Pauling's work relating to vitamin C will also be examined.
topics: Vitamin C Absorption and Tissue Accumulation
Vitamin C Deficiency, Toxicity, Linus Pauling and the Common Cold

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, you will learn about different categories of selenium. You will learn about selenoproteins and their functions and about selenium absorption and excretion. You will also learn about selenium toxicity and selenium's questionable deficiency.

modules.name: Module
modules.details: Diploma in Human Nutrition - Fifth Assessment
modules.description: You must score 80% or more to pass this assessment.
topics: Diploma in Human Nutrition - Fifth Assessment

modules.name: Module
topics: Diploma in Human Nutrition - Final Assessment
